page.title: 02A GEORDIE TALE
page.content: {"Hiya. A'm calld Graeham. A gan tu {Dunn Street School in Jarra. {Sumtimes a gan oot tu play with me {pals on the flyova. That's like a {bridge ower a bit motaway y'na. A like {watchin thu telly of a night an me da {gans doon the bar most nights. 'E sez {"Giz a broon pet" a few times 'n {staggas yem for 'es mince 'n tatties. {Why like that's all fo noo, so seeya." TRANSLATION "Hello. My name is Graham. I go to Dunn Street School in Jarrow. Sometimes I go out to play with my friends on the flyover. That's a bridge over a motorway. I like watching the television at night and my father goes out to the pub most nights. He says, "Give me a bottle of Newcastle Brown Ale, barmaid", a few times then staggers home for his mince and potatoes. That's all for now,bye."
